title: Ben Needham's mum blasts Greek police in week missing son would have turned 30
text:

Kerry Needham, whose missing son Ben would have turned 30 this week, says the Greek police should be “ashamed” they are not helping find him.

And she accused them of “ignoring” a file handed over by British police who believe toddler Ben died in a horror digger accident and his body hidden.

Ben’s furious mum wants prosecutors on the island of Kos to quiz a crucial witness who told British police about a possible accident but is now refusing to talk.

Kerry said: “I should have been planning a big party for Ben’s milestone birthday this week and blowing out candles. Instead I was lighting one in his memory.

“I’m ashamed of the Greek police. They are not doing their job. Any decent human being would want to find my son for me and to give closure to me and closure to the island.”

(Image: MDM)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Then aged just 21 months, Ben vanished on July 24 1991, on Kos, when he was with his grandparents while Kerry worked.

South Yorkshire Police have carried out two searches in Kos, the first was in 2012, when a mound of earth in front of the farmhouse where Ben was last seen playing was searched.

After a witness came forward and told them they believe Ben was killed in an accident, a second dig was arranged behind the property in 2016.

(Image: MDM)

Soil containing decomposed blood was found in the area where late digger driver, Konstantinos Barkas, known as Dino, was operating.

Kerry said an elderly witness told a British police boss how they spoke to Dino the morning after Ben vanished.

He was shaking and sweating and when he asked Dino if there had been an accident, he said: “Yes it’s possible. I heard a yelp but I thought it was a dog.”

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Intensive searches of the site only found a toy car thought to be Ben’s and part of his leather sandal.

Traces of DNA from a decomposed body were found in the car but it was not a match for Ben.

“The new prosecutor on Kos has been given South Yorkshire Police’s report. We’ve heard nothing,” said Kerry, 46, from Sheffield.

She added: “We haven’t even got a grave to go to. It’s so unfair.”

South Yorkshire Police confirmed a file has been passed to the Greek authorities and they were waiting for a meeting with the new prosecutor.
description: EXCLUSIVE: Kerry Needham accused Greek police of “ignoring” a file handed over by British police who believe toddler Ben died in a horror digger accident
